dialogue.htmlContent:
Unlike most of the Foloi Fields, the area which you find yourself travelling through seems to have been completely spared by Lunette's roaming bands of marauders. The surrounding fields are all in good condition, and the occasional stone barns and field shelters which you pass have managed to escape the destructive forces of the demonic centaur herds.

Upon a small hill sitting right in the middle of this area of untouched farmland, you see what might be the reason for this area being shielded from Lunette's daughters; four huge, modern-looking industrial barns are linked to one another by a long, single-story concrete office building. A thin strip around this modern farm has been concreted over, and tall arcane floodlights have been evenly positioned on the hard surface, #IF(game.isDayTime()) ready to bathe the premises in artificial, fluorescent light as soon as the sun sets. #ELSE which are bathing the premises in artificial, fluorescent light, allowing it to be seen from many miles away. #ENDIF

As you approach this industrial blot on an otherwise-rural landscape, you see a series of large, free-standing letters sitting atop the concrete office building, which spell out the words 'Evelyx's Dairy'. Although the barns are windowless, preventing any passersby from seeing inside to confirm for themselves, this name is enough to let anyone know that this farm specialises in milk production.

The path you're on leads you right up close to Evelyx's Dairy, but although there are many large, glass windows set into the sides of the concrete office building, they've been treated with a reflective finish, preventing you from taking a look inside. A sign positioned beside the entrance informs you that the farm is [style.italicsGood(open 24/7)], and any member of the public is welcome to head inside and enquire about either breeding their cows or working as one.

Looking up the gravel path which leads to the farm's entrance, you wonder if you should head inside, or instead continue on your way...

Deciding that you'd like to head inside Evelyx's Dairy, you [pc.walk] up the gravel path and approach the concrete office building. The main entrance consists of a pair of huge, mirrored-glass doors, and as you approach them, some kind of hidden arcane sensor detects your presence and sets them into motion. Sliding along rails recessed into the floor, the glass doors swiftly part, allowing you to [pc.step] forwards into the building.

You find yourself standing in the cavernous, modern-looking entrance hall to Evelyx's Dairy. Beneath your [pc.feet], clean, white tiles cover the floor, while up above your head, fluorescent lamps embedded in the high ceiling cast a bright, unnatural light over your surroundings. Several uninspiring pieces of abstract art hang on the plain white walls, and beneath them, numerous low-backed, black sofas have been arranged around stylish coffee tables.

There are a couple of people making use of these sofas, and as you enter the area, they give you a quick glance before looking back down to their magazines as they see that you're not the person who they were waiting for. #IF(dale.getLocationPlaceType()==PLACE_TYPE_innoxia_fields_dairyFarm_reception) Other than these members of the public, the only other person you can see #IF(dale.isPlayerKnowsName()) is the donkey-boy receptionist, Dale, who's busily filling out some paperwork behind his desk. #ELSE is a donkey-boy receptionist, who's busily filling out some paperwork behind the desk over on the far side of the room. #ENDIF #ELSE Other than these members of the public, there's nobody else in sight, as the reception desk over on the far side of the room is currently unstaffed. #ENDIF

From here, you could either exit the farm and head back out into the Foloi Fields, or [pc.walk] on over to the reception desk...
Deciding that you've had enough of Evelyx's Dairy for now, you [pc.walk] over to the large glass doors, and after they've slid aside, you head out into the Foloi Fields once again...

Just like the entrance hall, the corridor which runs down the centre of the farm's office building is floored in clean, white tiles, and illuminated by the bright, unnatural light of fluorescent lamps embedded in the high ceiling above your head. Instead of abstract artworks, however, the walls are home to numerous inspirational pictures and posters, which bear all manner of trite slogans encouraging the farm's cows to work hard.

At one end of the corridor, there's a large sign bearing the word 'Dormitories', while at the other end, a securely locked door prevents you from going any further. Three doors are set into one side of the corridor, with each one signposted as leading into a different barn, while on the other side you can find the farm's offices and milk storage area.

The door at this end of the corridor is securely locked and there are no windows or other means of seeing what's on the other side. A menacing sign fixed to one side of this door warns you that if you're caught trying to gain entry to the area beyond, you'll not only be instantly terminated from working here, but you'll also be subjected to prosecution.

Even if you did want to see find out what's on the other side, there's really no way to bypass the door's locking mechanism, and so all that you can do is turn around and head back the way you came...
Unable to get past the locked door, you [pc.step] back into the corridor and wonder where to go to next...

#IF(game.getCharactersPresent().contains(dale))

Positioned on the opposite side of the entrance hall to the pair of large, glass doors, there sits a long reception desk. It's of a very modern, stylish design, and has tall, smooth white sides and a frosted glass top. Another pair of mirrored glass doors, which no doubt lead into the rest of the farm, are positioned behind this desk, while to their side a large analogue clock hangs from the wall. Sitting behind the desk #IF(dale.isPlayerKnowsName()) is the donkey-boy receptionist, Dale, and as you approach he looks up from his paperwork and flashes you a kind smile. #ELSE is a greater donkey-boy receptionist, and as you approach he looks up from his paperwork and flashes you a kind smile. Looking down at the small name plate sitting on the desk in front of him, you see that this donkey-boy is called 'Mr. [dale.surname]'. #ENDIF

#IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_evelyx_work_started)) #IF(pc.isVisiblyPregnant() && pc.getPregnantLitter().getFather().equals(dale)) #IF(!pc.isCharacterReactedToPregnancy(dale))

[pc.Stepping] forwards, you present your swollen belly to the donkey-boy, and upon seeing that you're pregnant, he very quickly realises that he must be the father. Tentatively reaching out to gently rub his strong hands over your distended stomach, he marvels, [dale.speech(I really got you pregnant? Wow... Just let me know if there's anything I can do to help! I'll try to make time for you if you need it.)]

#ELSE

[pc.Stepping] forwards, you present your swollen belly to the donkey-boy, letting him know that you're still pregnant with his children. Tentatively reaching out to gently rub his strong hands over your distended stomach, he smiles and repeats his previous offer, [dale.speech(Just let me know if there's anything I can do to help. I'll try to make time for you if you need it.)]

#ENDIF

Thanking Dale for his kind offer, you tell him that you're able to handle things yourself, to which he replies, [dale.speech(Well, if you change your mind then just let me know. Is there anything else I can help you with today?)]

#ELSE

[dale.speech(Hi, [pc.name]!)] he happily calls out, before sitting to attention and quickly straightening his black tie. Brushing down his navy blue shirt, #IF(dale.getTotalTimesHadSex(pc)>0) he winks at you and teases, [dale.speech(How's work going? You haven't been getting lonely in there without me, have you?)] #ELSE he asks, [dale.speech(How's work going? If you've got any complaints or suggestions, please let me know!)] #ENDIF

As you tell the donkey-boy that everything is going fine, and that you don't have anything to complain about, he quickly finishes the last drop of coffee in his mug, before looking at you with weary eyes and saying in his usual upbeat tone of voice, #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_evelyx_reception_sex)) [dale.speech(Well, if there's anything you want, then let me know. Oh, and I've got my eye on you; don't try getting under my desk again...)] #ELSE [dale.speech(Well, if there's anything you want, then just say the word.)] #ENDIF

With that, Dale starts to reorganise the stacks of paperwork in front of him, leaving you wondering whether to simply continue on your way past him or to stop and ask him about something...

#ENDIF #ELSEIF(dale.isPlayerKnowsName())

[dale.speech(Hi, [pc.name]!)] he happily calls out, before sitting to attention and quickly straightening his black tie. Brushing down his navy blue shirt, he asks, [dale.speech(Would you like to inquire about our cow sex services? Or are you here to ask about becoming a cow yourself?)]

Stifling a yawn, the donkey-boy quickly finishes the last drop of coffee in his mug, before looking at you with weary eyes and waiting to hear what it is you want...

#ELSE

[dale.speech(Oh, you can call me Dale, don't worry about that,)] he happily says after noticing where you're looking. Sitting to attention and quickly straightening his black tie, he brushes down his navy blue shirt and continues, [dale.speech(I haven't seen you here before, so welcome to Evelyx's Dairy! If you're here to make inquiries about bulk milk orders, then I'm afraid to say that we don't have any contracts available right now. If, on the other hand, you're here for more personal business, then we offer a service whereby you can pay to have sex with one of our cows. No, those aren't actual cows, before you ask; that's just what we call our employees whose work involves being milked in the barns.)]

Despite his friendly mannerisms, you notice that there's a weary look in Dale's [dale.eyeColour] eyes, and after finishing his introduction, he stifles a yawn and sinks down in his chair a little. Suddenly remembering something, he quickly bends down to retrieve an item from under his desk. Seeing this as a good moment to introduce yourself to him, you tell Dale your name, and as he straightens back up and places a few sheets of paper on the desk before him, he flashes you another kind smile and says, [dale.speech(Pleased to meet you, [pc.name].)]

Moving some empty coffee cups aside, Dale slides the papers he's just retrieved towards you and continues, [dale.speech(We're always looking for new cows, so if you were interested in that sort of work, then all you need to do is read over this contract, sign up, and we can get you started straight away. Sorry if that's not what you're here for, but I have to offer this to every new visitor, regardless of who they are...)]

Shrugging off his slight embarrassment at having to offer you the opportunity to become a 'cow', the donkey-boy smiles and says, [dale.speech(Just let me know if you're interested in either of these things, and I can give you more details.)]

As Dale takes a moment to reorganise the stacks of paperwork in front of him, you wonder what to say next...

#ENDIF #ELSE

Positioned on the opposite side of the entrance hall to the pair of large, glass doors, there sits a long reception desk. It's of a very modern, stylish design, and has tall, smooth white sides and a frosted glass top. Another pair of mirrored glass doors, which no doubt lead into the rest of the farm, are positioned behind this desk, while to their side a large analogue clock hangs from the wall. #IF(dale.isPlayerKnowsName()) Despite the exterior sign promising that the farm is 'open 24/7', the donkey-boy receptionist, Dale, is currently absent from his post, and a sign left on the desk's top reveals: #ELSE Despite the exterior sign promising that the farm is 'open 24/7', the farm's receptionist is currently absent from their post, and a sign left on the desk's top reveals: #ENDIF

Reception Desk Closed
Normal service will resume at [style.time(5)].
Please feel free to take a seat in the waiting area.

Looking over to the clock hanging on the wall behind this reception desk, you see that the current time is [style.currentTime]. If you wanted to, you could return to the waiting area and loiter about until #IF(dale.isPlayerKnowsName()) #IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_evelyx_work_started)) Dale returns. Then again, as you're an employee, you could always head over to the dormitory and see if you can find Dale in there... #ELSE Dale returns... #ENDIF #ELSE the receptionist returns... #ENDIF

#ENDIF

#IF(game.getCharactersPresent().contains(dale)) You thank Dale for his time and say that you've got to leave, before [pc.stepping] back into the waiting area. Flashing you one last smile, the donkey-boy gives you a wave, and after stifling a weary sigh, he says, [dale.speech(Thanks for stopping by. We're open at all hours every day of the week, so come back at any time!)] #ELSE #IF(dale.isPlayerKnowsName()) As Dale isn't currently on duty, there's very little else for you to do except [pc.step] back into the waiting area. Taking a quick look around, you wonder whether to loiter about and wait for him to return, or exit Evelyx's Dairy and head elsewhere... #ELSE As the receptionist isn't currently on duty, there's very little else for you to do except [pc.step] back into the waiting area. Taking a quick look around, you wonder whether to loiter about and wait for them to return, or exit Evelyx's Dairy and head elsewhere... #ENDIF #ENDIF

As you stand before Dale's desk, you find yourself thinking about how much fun the two of you had in the barn. [dale.speech(What are you doing?!)] the donkey-boy urgently hisses down at you, [dale.speech(There are clients waiting right over there, and I might have to get up to go to the barns at any moment! You can't do this here!)]

Just take it as slow as you want, and please try not to make too much noise...)] #ELSE Turned on and clearly wanting this to happen almost as much as you do, Dale lets out a deep, horny grunt, before hissing, [dale.speech(Ok, let's do this then. Just take it as slow as you want, and please try not to make too much noise...)] #ENDIF

Finally working your way up to kiss the flat, flared head of Dale's equine cock, you lick up the salty precum that's oozing from his urethra, before wrapping your [pc.lips+] around his shaft and taking it into your mouth. #ENDIF

[dale.speech(That's it... Don't stop...)] Dale groans under his breath, before placing one of his hands on the back of your head and encouraging you to keep going by applying a gentle downward pressure. Planting one last kiss on Dale's delicious donkey-dick, you take a moment to savour the musky, masculine taste of his cock before putting an end to things by shuffling back out from under his desk. Letting out a satisfied groan, Dale looks down at you and sighs, [dale.speech(That was amazing... That is, I mean to say, you really shouldn't be doing that sort of thing here while I'm at work...)]

What do you want me to say, that I'd like for you to do this again?)]

Interrupting him before he can say anything else, you tell Dale that you'll definitely treat him to this again in the future. Letting out a defeated sigh as he realises that he's not going to be able to convince you to not bother him while at work, the donkey-boy waits for you to return to the other side of his desk before asking if there was anything else you needed from him.

You ask Dale if he's got a moment in which to talk. He casts a weary eye over the stack of paperwork in front of him, and you think that he's going to decline, but after letting out a deep sigh he gives you a genuinely warm smile and says, [dale.speech(Of course, [pc.name]. What it is that you'd like to talk about?)]

Happy to hear that the donkey-boy is willing to make time for you, you wonder what to talk to him about first...

Wanting to know a little more about Dale, you ask him about what led to him working here at Evelyx's Dairy, and for how long has he been doing it.

[dale.speech(You know, you're the first person to ever ask me about that,)] he replies with a small laugh. Leaning back in his chair, he brushes down his tall, donkey-like ears with one hand as he thinks for a moment, before replying, [dale.speech(It must be going on three years since I started working here now. I used to work at an office over in Dominion, but after a relationship with one of my colleagues went bad, she made working there unbearable. I don't want to bore you with all of the petty details, but basically things ended with me deciding to leave the city just to get away from her.)]

After interrupting to offer the donkey-boy your sympathy, you listen as he continues, [dale.speech(So I decided to travel to Elis and try and make a living there. On my way through the Fields, I saw a sign offering a receptionist job at a farm, and after following the directions, I arrived here. Evelyx was almost as desperate to have this vacancy filled as I was to be getting a job, and so before I'd even arrived at Elis, I found myself working here.)]

Wanting to know more, you ask Dale if he ended up getting a new place to live in Elis, or found somewhere a little closer to work. Letting out a small laugh, he reveals, [dale.speech(Well, technically my permanent residence is a small apartment in Elis, but with how much work Evelyx keeps on piling on me, I haven't been home in weeks. I don't really mind, though; my apartment's in the rough part of town, and the beds in the dormitories here are comfortable enough.)]

With that, Dale seems to be at the limit of how much he wants to reveal about himself, and so pointedly asks, [dale.speech(Is there anything else you'd like to talk about?)]

Curious about what kind of duties Dale is expected to perform as the farm's receptionist, you ask him about what kind of paperwork he's currently dealing with.

[dale.speech(Well, these are the cows' daily performance reports which need to be assessed and signed off,)] he replies, gesturing to the stack of papers in front of him. Rubbing his weary eyes, he lets out a small sigh and reveals, [dale.speech(This should be the responsibility of the office workers, but the number of cows we have working here has more than quadrupled over the past two years, and Evelyx hasn't hired any additional employees to keep up. So the short of it is that this extra paperwork keeps on getting offloaded onto me.)]

Noting the significant amount of papers before him, you ask Dale if he's able to keep up with his receptionist duties on top of all this. Puffing up his cheat a little in pride, he smiles and boasts, [dale.speech(Of course! It's a lot of work, but someone needs to do it. I've also had to take on responsibility for attending to any new cows we employ, and even with that, I'm still able to get all of my work completed each day.)]

Although he displays an admirable work ethic, you can't help but feel like this workload must be taking its toll on Dale's health. As you express this to him, the donkey-boy simply dismisses your concerns with a wave of his hand and states, [dale.speech(Us donkey-morphs are used to hard work, so this is nothing. I mostly get enough sleep, and always have three healthy meals a day. There's no need to be worried about me.)]

Running his hand back over his tall, donkey-like ears, he smiles and brings the topic to a close by asking, [dale.speech(Is there something else which you wanted to discuss?)]

Wanting to hear Dale's opinion of his boss, you ask him what Evelyx is like.

[dale.speech(Well, she's a direct daughter of the elder lilin, Lisophia,)] the donkey-boy says, as though that should explain everything. Seeing that you'd like some more information than that, however, he quickly continues, [dale.speech(Lisophia's well known for her greed, and her daughter's inherited that trait by having a complete obsession with money. I don't mind the workload, but some of my colleagues over in the office are almost at their breaking point with how hard Evelyx is working them. She refuses to hire more people as that would, in her own words, 'eat up all of the profits'.)]

Asking what else Dale can tell you about this greedy succubus, you listen as Dale smiles and states, [dale.speech(Well, there's not really too much that I know about her. I met her for my initial interview, and I see her every few months for a quarterly performance report, but other than that I only very briefly interact with her when taking visitors to and from her office. She hates to be interrupted, and only meets with people who have important business to discuss with her.)]

Leaning back in his chair, Dale thinks for a moment, before stating, [dale.speech(She's not a bad person. Sure, she works her employees hard, but she also gives the cows pretty decent working conditions. You'd be hard pressed to find a modern dairy farm that gives their cows the same level of comfort or flexible hours that this one does.)]

Having said all there is on the matter, the donkey-boy smiles at you and states, [dale.speech(Anyway, enough about Evelyx. Is there anything else you wanted to ask?)]

Interested to hear about this farm's history, you ask Dale what he knows about how it got started.

[dale.speech(I can't really help you much there,)] he sighs, [dale.speech(I only started working here a few years ago, and by that time everything was already pretty much as it is now.)]

At that moment, the donkey-boy suddenly seems to remember something, and after asking you to wait for one moment, he bends down and starts rummaging around in the drawers behind his desk. After a couple of minutes of searching, the donkey-boy finds what he was looking for, and pulls out a framed, aerial photograph of a traditional-looking farmhouse. Placing it on the desk for you to look at, he explains, [dale.speech(Apparently, that's what this farm used to look like. Of course, that old house was demolished a long time ago, and I guess that the surrounding barns were similarly torn down after they fell into disrepair.)]

Having discovered all that Dale knows about this farm's history, you move on to ask him about how it currently functions. As this is a topic which he's much more familiar with, the donkey-boy enthusiastically replies, [dale.speech(Well, we operate in the same way that most other modern dairy farms do. We employ a large number of 'cows', who lie in their stalls for up to sixteen hours a day, having their milk drained by machines. This milk is treated and stored in large vats, and then a carriage arrives twice a day to transport the milk to the processing and bottling plant on the outskirts of Dominion.)]

With all of your questions about the farm now answered, you wonder what to ask about next...

Wanting to know why this farm has been spared from the destruction wrought by Lunette's marauders, you ask Dale what he knows about the elder lilin or her daughters.

[dale.speech(Well, I don't really know anything special about Lunette herself, other than what anyone else could tell you about her,)] he replies, before glancing around and lowering his voice to reveal, [dale.speech(As for why this farm isn't attacked like most of the others in the Fields... Well, I probably shouldn't be telling you this, but I heard from one of the other workers that Evelyx has some kind of deal with Lunette...)]

Wanting to know more, you ask the donkey-boy what kind of deal that would be. Nervously glancing back over his shoulder to make sure that nobody's eavesdropping, he speculates, [dale.speech(I don't know what goes on in there, but it's definitely got something to do with the fourth barn we have here. I regularly attend to some of the cows in all three of the other barns, but as far as I know, nobody who works here has ever been inside the fourth one. We've know that some of Lunette's daughters are given regular access to it, but what goes on inside, nobody knows...)]

After taking a moment to think about whether or not to say any more, the donkey-boy runs his hand over his tall ears, before leaning in close to you and practically whispering, [dale.speech(Of course, there's the matter of what happened to the receptionist whose job I took... One of the other workers told me that in the days before she disappeared, this receptionist was asking a lot of questions about that fourth barn. Although everyone calls him crazy, this worker swears that he saw Evelyx leading the receptionist towards the fourth barn on the night that she vanished...)]

Clearly thinking that he's already said too much, Dale sits back up and clears his throat, before saying, [dale.speech(Anyway, it's best not to ask too many questions about Lunette. She's bad news, and the less I or anyone else has to do with her, the better.)]

Thanking Dale for the information, you wonder what to ask about next...
Having asked Dale everything which you wanted to know, you thank him for his time and wonder what to do next...

Wanting to know more about having sex with one of the Dairy's cows, you ask Dale for the full details.

[dale.speech(Of course, hold on one moment, please,)] he replies with a smile. Quickly bending down and opening one of the drawers beneath his desk, the donkey-boy retrieves a sheet of laminated paper and places it in front of you. Looking down at the paper, you see that the page is split into three parts, and as you scan over the text, Dale begins to deliver a confident, well-practised sales pitch.

#IF(flags.hasFlag(FLAG_innoxia_evelyx_work_started)) [dale.speech(As you should already know, you cows are split into three barns based on your promotion level; 'Trainee', 'Heifer', and 'Cow', and you can choose any one of these to have sex with,)] #ELSE [dale.speech(Our cows are split into three barns based on their promotion level; 'Trainee', 'Heifer', and 'Cow', and you can choose any one of these to have sex with,)] #ENDIF he begins, before pointing to the top of the page and explaining, [dale.speech(The requirement for trainees to get promoted is for them to be publicly fucked, so if you decide to choose a trainee to have sex with, then you'll be their first. Their pussies are well-used and pretty loose, and as such they aren't as popular as trainees or heifers. They don't get to choose when they get fucked, though, so you can look around and choose whichever cow you like the look of the most. Every cow in this barn is a cow-girl, so if that's not your thing you'd be better off going with a trainee. Take a moment to look at the prices, and let me know if you want one. Oh, and we offer partial refunds if your cow isn't to your liking. You'll get back what you paid minus five hundred flames to cover admin fees.)]
